reference.title: Backing up and restoring applications
reference.shortdesc: Having accurate and tested backups can mitigate problems caused by software or hardware issues. can back up and restore the entire and application installation.

section.p: You can use the browser interface or command-line interface (CLI) to back up and restore applications. This sections applies to using the browser interface only. For more information, about using the CLI, see .

You can back up configuration information and data from an application and then later restore to the same instance. To provide a historical archive, back up on a regular schedule. Back up as needed when you perform less-frequent tasks such as moving data from one instance to another or duplicating an instance for testing or failover purposes.

Before undertaking the following actions, ensure that you have a recent backup that successfully restores:
Upgrading
Testing
Using a temporary VM or DR site

When a full backup is not necessary, such as when you need a checkpoint before installing software, you can perform a snapshot of the system. If you need to revert back to a snapshot, use the rollback feature. You use the CLI to perform snapshot and rollback. For more information, see .
